New Records: Niclas Füllkrug headed in an 85th minute goal to give Euro 2024 hosts Germany a 2-1 comeback victory over Netherlands in their international friendly on Tuesday and make it two victories from two matches in the past four days.
Key Match Events: Joey Veerman volleyed in following a mistake by defender Maximilian Mittelstaedt after four minutes
Maximilian Mittelstaedt made amends with a perfectly curled shot into the top corner seven minutes later
Niclas Füllkrug headed in from close range for his 11th goal in his 15th international in the 85th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Julian Nagelsmann emphasized the importance of adapting their game in terms of positions
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann praised the spirit of the team, saying 'it is more comfortable to go into this break with two wins' and 'it was confirmation that we can not only keep up against some teams, but dominate the matches'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany had more than 70% possession in the first half hour
The tempo dropped considerably after the break and the visitors started gaining more space
Others: The match was played at the Deutsche Bank Park in Frankfurt, Germany with a crowd of 48,390 spectators
